<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 306, 220, 321]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 327, 358, 344]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3 (P3)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 460, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 325, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 540, 285, 555]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 555, 910, 586]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 586, 595, 601]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 601, 606, 616]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 630, 609, 646]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 646, 756, 661]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 661, 440, 676]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 75.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 767, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\ln \left(1 + 2^{x}\right) = 2\), giving your answer correct to 3 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 918, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 77, 96, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 76, 161, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 75, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
By sketching suitable graphs, show that the equation \(\mathrm{e}^{-\frac{1}{2}x} = 4 - x^2\) has one positive root and one negative root.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 92, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 505, 156, 523]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 505, 710, 524]]<|/det|>
Verify by calculation that the negative root lies between \(-1\) and \(-1.5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 505, 920, 524]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 77, 153, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 75, 920, 112]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula \(x_{n + 1} = -\sqrt{(4 - \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{1}{2}x_n})}\) to determine this root correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 92, 920, 111]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 73, 156, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Express \(8 \cos \theta - 15 \sin \theta\) in the form \(R \cos (\theta + \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0^\circ < \alpha < 90^\circ\), stating the exact value of \(R\) and giving the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 126]]<|/det|>
The curve with equation \(y = \mathrm{e}^{-ax}\tan x\), where \(a\) is a positive constant, has only one point in the interval \(0< x< \frac{1}{2}\pi\) at which the tangent is parallel to the \(x\)-axis. Find the value of \(a\) and state the exact value of the \(x\)-coordinate of this point.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 888, 92]]<|/det|>
The line \(l\) has equation \(\mathbf{r} = \mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} - 3\mathbf{k} + \lambda (2\mathbf{i} - \mathbf{j} + \mathbf{k})\). The plane \(p\) has equation \(3x + y - 5z = 20\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 103, 156, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 103, 465, 121]]<|/det|>
Show that the line \(l\) lies in the plane \(p\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
A second plane is parallel to \(l\), perpendicular to \(p\) and contains the point with position vector \(3\mathbf{i} - \mathbf{j} + 2\mathbf{k}\). Find the equation of this plane, giving your answer in the form \(ax + by + cz = d\). [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 83, 616, 241]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 257, 920, 324]]<|/det|>
A water tank has vertical sides and a horizontal rectangular base, as shown in the diagram. The area of the base is \(2 \mathrm{~m}^2\). At time \(t = 0\) the tank is empty and water begins to flow into it at a rate of \(1 \mathrm{~m}^3\) per hour. At the same time water begins to flow out from the base at a rate of \(0.2 \sqrt{h} \mathrm{~m}^3\) per hour, where \(h \mathrm{~m}\) is the depth of water in the tank at time \(t\) hours.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 336, 156, 355]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 336, 920, 371]]<|/det|>
Form a differential equation satisfied by \(h\) and \(t\), and show that the time \(T\) hours taken for the depth of water to reach \(4 \mathrm{~m}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 375, 920, 420]]<|/det|>
\[T = \int_{0}^{4}\frac{10}{5 - \sqrt{h}}\mathrm{d}h. \quad [3]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 154, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 586, 92]]<|/det|>
Using the substitution \(u = 5 - \sqrt{h}\), find the value of \(T\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 78, 94, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 332, 107]]<|/det|>
Let \(\operatorname {f}(x) = \frac{x(6 - x)}{(2 + x)(4 + x^2)}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 117, 156, 135]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 117, 416, 136]]<|/det|>
Express \(\operatorname {f}(x)\) in partial fractions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 117, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 154, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
Hence obtain the expansion of \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in ascending powers of \(x\), up to and including the term in \(x^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Using integration by parts, or otherwise, find the exact value of the area of the shaded region between the curve, the \(x\)-axis and the normal \(PQ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
